isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 9600, 9700 AND 9800 SERIES - REPLACE - CLUTCH PEDAL SHAFT BEARING

svcproc.title: CLUTCH PEDAL SHAFT BEARING
svcproc.para: The procedure outlined below should be followed when replacement of the clutch pedal, clutch pedal shaft or pedal shaft bearings is required ( Figure 10).

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. PEDAL STOP NUT (2) AND FLAT WASHER (2)
8. FLANGE BOLT AND FLANGE LOCK NUT

step1.para: Remove the radiator grille upper panel and radiator access panel.
Tilt the cab forward (45 degrees) and secure with the safety prop.
Disconnect the control rod return spring.
Disconnect the upper (vertical) clutch control rod from the pedal shaft lever by removing the cotter and yoke pins.
Remove the pedal shaft lever clamp bolt and aligning washer. Remove lever from pedal shaft.
Inspect the yoke pin holes in the pedal shaft lever and control rod. If worn, replace parts. Inspect the yoke pins. Replace if worn. Lower the cab.
Remove the bolts and lockwashers securing the right (inner) bearing assembly to the cab engine cover panel.
Remove the bolts, nuts and lockwashers securing the left (outer) bearing assembly to the mounting bracket.
Remove the pedal shaft (with pedal and bearing assemblies), taking care not to damage electrical wiring, air ducts, etc.
Remove the snap ring from the left (outer) end of the shaft. Remove the bearing assemblies from the shaft. Discard the old bearing assemblies.
Remove the clutch pedal clamp bolt and aligning washer. Remove the pedal from the shaft.
Inspect the pedal shaft. Replace if worn or damaged.

Position the clutch pedal on the pedal shaft. Align the slot of the pedal with the key slot in the shaft and install the aligning washer. Install the pedal clamp bolt and nut. Tighten the bolt to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 N•m).
Lubricate the bearing surfaces of the bearing assemblies with a light coat of grease (chassis lubricant).
Position the new bearing assemblies on the ends of shaft.
Install the snap ring on left (outer) end of the shaft.
Position the shaft (with pedal and bearing assemblies) in cab engine cover panel and mounting bracket. Be careful not to damage electrical wiring, air ducts, etc.
Install the bearing assembly mounting bolts, nuts and lockwashers. DO NOT tighten bolts.

Make sure the pedal shaft pivots freely in the bearing assemblies. Tighten bearing assembly mounting bolts to 25 to 38 ft-lbs. (34 to 51 N•m). Recheck for free shaft rotation after tightening the bolts.
Tilt the cab forward (45 degrees) and secure with the safety prop.

Position the pedal shaft lever on shaft. Align the slot of the lever with the key slot in the shaft and install the aligning washer, the lever clamp bolt and nut. Tighten the bolt to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 N•m).
Connect the upper (vertical) control rod to the pedal shaft lever with the yoke pin. Install a new cotter pin.

important.para: The yoke pin must be installed so that the end with the cotter pin hole points outward (toward driver's side of vehicle).

step1.para: Connect the return spring.
Lower the cab.
Check the clutch internal, clutch pedal, and linkage adjustments. Readjust as needed. Refer to ADJUSTMENT
Install the radiator access panel and radiator grille upper panel.
